alert.note: Alert for Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:44AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Cayuga. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 AM EST, Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. At 10 AM, the Owasco Inlet was at 8.97 feet. Moderate flood stage is 9.0 feet. The river is approaching crest and may still rise another few tenths of a foot before receding this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moravia. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
